qas.question: What serves as the collective Head of State?
How many members are in the Federal Council?
Who elects the members of the Federal Council?
What is the traditional term for the President of the Confederation?
Who elects the President of the Confederation from its 7 members?

context: <a0_0>The Federal Council<a0_0/> constitutes the federal government, directs the federal administration and serves as collective Head of State. It is a collegial body of <a1_0>seven<a1_0/> members, elected for a four-year mandate by the <a2_0>Federal Assembly<a2_0/> which also exercises oversight over the Council. The President of the Confederation is elected by <a4_0>the Assembly<a4_0/> from among the seven members, traditionally in rotation and for a <a3_0>one-year<a3_0/> term; the President chairs the government and assumes representative functions. However, the president is a primus inter pares with no additional powers, and remains the head of a department within the administration.
